definition[0]: when you work together with another person or group to achieve something, especially in science or art
example[0]: The company is building the centre in collaboration with the Institute of Offshore Engineering.
example[1]: a collaboration between the two theatres
example[2]: The project has involved collaboration with the geography department.
definition[1]: when someone gives help to a country that their country is fighting a war with, especially one that has taken control of their country
definition[2]: the activity of working together with another person, company etc in order to achieve something
example[3]: More collaboration between companies is needed to speed up the development of cleaner fuels for cars.
example[4]: The research was done by two university medical departments, working in collaboration with each other.
definition[3]: a piece of work that is produced by two or more people, companies etc working together
example[5]: The software is a collaboration involving NGB Technologies and the Gas Research Institute.
